author: JAKE COYLE AP film writer
title: Swift bests Scorsese at box office, but 'Killers of the Flower Moon" opens strongly
description: In a movie match-up almost as unlikely as “Barbie” and “Oppenheimer,” Martin Scorsese took on Taylor Swift in cinemas over the weekend

author: LINDSEY BAHR AP film writer
title: A muted box office weekend without ‘Dune: Part Two’
description: Universal and Blumhouse's video game adaptation “Five Nights at Freddy's” topped the North American box office in its second weekend according to studio estimates Sunday, while “Taylor Swift: The Eras Tour” placed second

author: LINDSEY BAHR AP film writer
title: Video game adaptation ‘Five Nights at Freddy’s’ notches $130 million global debut
description: Fans flocked to movie theaters across the country to see the scary video game adaptation “Five Nights at Freddy's” on the big screen, which made $78 million to top the North American box office

author: JOCELYN NOVECK AP national writer
title: Movie Review: Nicolas Cage finds fame to be highly overrated in chillingly funny ‘Dream Scenario’
description: Nicolas Cage, perhaps best known for his onscreen volatility, takes a fascinating swerve to play a mundane, schlubby, balding professor at nowhere famous in Kristoffer Borgli's “Dream Scenario.”

author: John Nolte, John Nolte
title: Nolte: Taylor Swift’s Box Office Triumph Makes Hollywood Tremble
description: Nolte -- "Taylor Swift: The Eras Tour" broke box office records last weekend and left-wing Hollywood didn’t make a dime.

author: John Nolte, John Nolte
title: Nolte: Taylor Swift Humiliates Hollywood Again -- Trounces Leo’s ‘Flower Moon’
description: Nolte: "Taylor Swift: The Eras Tour" grossed another $32 million, humiliating Leonardo Di Caprio’s "Killers of the Flower Moon," which debuted to just $22 million.

author: Alana Mastrangelo, Alana Mastrangelo
title: Rap Group Death Grips End Concert When Fans Won’t Stop Throwing Glow Sticks at Them
description: The hip hop group Death Grips cut its performance in Fayetteville, Arkansas, last week after fans wouldn't stop throwing glow sticks at them.

author: Juliana Kaplan
title: A movie theater staffer describes what it was like to work Taylor Swift's Eras Tour film premiere, which was so loud it blew out 2 amps
description: Taylor Swift's Eras Tour film was so loud it blew the sound system in one theater.

title: Nvidia boss Jensen Huang joked that Jackie Chan should play him in a movie
description: "I'll do my own stunts, yeah. I'll do all my own typing," Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang joked.

author: Madeline Berg
title: AMC's CEO thought he was texting naughty photos to a former ballerina fling. Then everything went haywire.
description: A monthslong blackmail attempt for hundreds of thousands of dollars targeted AMC's CEO Adam Aron. He stood his ground.

description: Jordan Kawchuk had promised his daughters that they’d watch Taylor Swift’s movie together. And they did — even if it wasn’t in the same theatre sitting side-by-side.

title: Taylor Swift commands a huge fan base — and for some, it borders on spiritual
description: There’s been a fervent fan base surrounding Taylor Swift and her brand of music since she burst onto the scene in 2006. But more recently, that devotion has been taken to new heights, particularly given the record-breaking success of her worldwide Eras Tour c…

title: Taylor Swift to bring Eras Tour to Vancouver for 3 nights in December 2024
description: Taylor Swift is preparing to bring her Eras Tour to Vancouver for three nights next December.

title: Taylor Swift has given theaters a sugar rush. What they need is a steady drip of hits

author: Rachyl Jones
title: NBC's successor to Yaccarino reveals the power of NFL commercials: 'There’s no bigger brand in the world than Taylor Swift, and she still needed help to actually sell tickets'
description: Average daily ticket sales for Swift’s movie rose 50% after commercials during NFL broadcasts.

author: Jessica Nix, Bloomberg
title: Taylor Swift's tour movie is as big of a hit as her concerts as the film breaks a more than decade-old box office record
description: The Eras Tour film delivered opening weekend sales that were higher than the debut of any prior concert picture since Justin Bieber's Never Say Never.

author: Jake Coyle, The Associated Press
title: Taylor Swift rakes in another $31 million, holds off Martin Scorsese's 'Killers' to stay atop the box office
description: “Killers of the Flower Moon," which cost Apple Studios at least $200 million, debuted with $23 million, the third-best opening for Martin Scorsese.

author: Lindsey Bahr, The Associated Press
title: The box office just had one of its slowest weekends all year as Hollywood strikes delayed the release of blockbuster 'Dune: Part Two'
description: The release of the “Dune” sequel was pushed to March 2024 amid the dual writers' and actors' strikes, and no major blockbusters moved in to take its spot.

author: Jake Coyle, The Associated Press
title: ‘The Marvels’ struggles at box office amid superhero fatigue: ‘The growth of the genre has stopped’
description: The 33rd installment in the Marvel Cinematic Universe managed less than a third of the $153.4 million its predecessor launched with.

author: Jane Thier
title: An expensing firm CFO just revealed how remote work changes employee perks
description: For proof, take a look at the $21,000 VIP dinner, $350 haircut, and Taylor Swift concert tickets that workers got reimbursed last year.

title: Video game adaptation 'Five Nights at Freddy's' tops weekend box office even with simultaneous streaming release
description: The Blumhouse production adapts the game in which a security guard has to fend off murderous animatronic characters at a family pizza restaurant.

title: Striking actors told not to dress up as Hollywood-centric stars this Halloween

title: AMC Theatres posts best revenue and attendance since pandemic began as it closes money-losing locations and rakes in cash from 'Barbenheimer' bonanza

title: Taylor Swift asks fans not to throw objects on stage
